title: 103_hr3773
content: Title I of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 is amended to include eligibility criteria for loans and reduction of loan subsidies. Eligibility for loans requires the inability to obtain credit elsewhere at reasonable rates. Loan subsidies are reduced by setting an interest rate on loans and advances under the Act. The interest rate on loans made under the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 will be determined by the Administrator based on various factors, including the purpose of the loan and the borrower's creditworthiness. Amendments to the Act remove the previous fixed interest rate of 2 percent per annum. Amendments to the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 remove the fixed interest rate of 2 percent per annum on loans. Various sections of the Act are amended to redesignate subsections and paragraphs accordingly. The authorities related to telephone loans and grants are terminated. Amendments are made to various sections of the Act related to telephone service, including removing references to improving telephone service in rural areas and financing facilities for telephone service. The authorities for telephone loans and grants are terminated. Amendments are made to various sections of the Act related to telephone service, including removing references to improving telephone service in rural areas and financing facilities for telephone service. The authorities for telephone loans and grants are terminated. Section 18 is amended by removing the Governor of the telephone bank, Title II is repealed, and sections 301, 302, and 305 are amended to remove references to telephone services. Amendments are made to various sections of the Act related to telephone service, including removing references to improving telephone service in rural areas and financing facilities for telephone service. Sections 305, 306, 309, 313, and 314 are amended to remove specific language related to telephone services. Repeal of Title IV and Title V of the Act related to telephone service. SEC. 4. LOAN PRIORITY. Amends the Rural Electrification Act to prioritize loans based on need and application timing. SEC. 5. TRANSITION RULES. The Administrator of the Rural Electrification Administration will return unnecessary amounts received from telephone loans made under the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 to the Treasury. They will also determine the disposition of assets related to these loans and retire the stock of the Rural Telephone Bank after settling all liabilities. After settling all liabilities, any remaining surplus or contingency reserve from the Rural Telephone Bank will be distributed to holders of class A and class B stock issued before the effective date of the Act. The Act and its amendments will take effect on the 1st day of the first Federal fiscal year that begins 60 or more days after the enactment date.
